alert.note: Alert for Oxford (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 18 at 8:49PM EDT until July 18 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 900 PM EDT FOR NORTHWESTERN OXFORD COUNTY... At 846 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 10 miles northeast of Errol, or 14 miles southwest of Rangeley, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Andover, Errol, Grafton, Byron, Magalloway Plantation, Adamstown, Richardsontown, South Arm, Upton, Lincoln Plantation, Lower Cupsuptic, Parkertown, Upper Cupsuptic and Wentworth Location. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
